parameters.name: filter[date_from]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include moves on and after the given date, e.g. `2019-05-02`

parameters.name: filter[date_to]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include moves up to and including the given date, e.g. `2019-05-09`

parameters.name: filter[created_at_from]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include moves created on or after the given date, e.g. `2019-05-02`

parameters.name: filter[created_at_to]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include moves created on or before the given date, e.g. `2019-05-09`

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include moves with the given statuses

parameters.name: filter[from_location_id]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include moves from the given location UUIDs

parameters.name: filter[to_location_id]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include moves to the given location UUIDs

parameters.name: sort[by]
parameters.description: field to sort results by

parameters.name: sort[direction]
parameters.description: direction to sort by

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The move object to be created

patch.summary: Updates a move. Aliased as PUT /moves/{move_id}.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The move object to be modified

delete.description:
## [DO NOT USE]

Moves should be cancelled instead of deleted

post.summary: [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED] Creates a completed move event
post.description:
## [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED]

Creating a completed move event changes the underlying move's status to be `completed`. It _does not_ alter the journeys associated with the move: additional API calls will be necessary to complete or cancel existing journeys.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The completed move event object to be created. It must specify `timestamp`.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The document object to be created

get.summary: [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED] Gets a list of journeys
get.description:
## [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED]

This method gets an ordered and paged list of journeys associated with the specified move. Journeys are ordered by `timestamp`.

post.summary: [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED] Creates a new journey
post.description:
## [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED]

This creates a new journey record and appends it to the move. It _does not_ update the destination of the parent move record: an additional call to the redirects endpoint will be required in order to change the move destination.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The journey object to be created. It must specify `timestamp`, `billable`, `from_location` and `to_location`.

get.description:
## [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED]

This method gets the specified journey associated with the move.

patch.summary: [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED] Updates a journey's metadata
patch.description:
## [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED]

This method updates the specified journey's metadata (e.g. `billable` or vehicle details). It _does not_ update the `from_location` or `to_location` of a journey: to change the locations cancel the journey and create a new one.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The journey object to be updated. It must specify `timestamp`, `billable`; it must not specify locations.

post.summary: [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED] Creates a lockout event
post.description:
## [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED]

Creating a lockout event _does not_ change the underlying move's status or destination. It _does not_ alter the journeys associated with the move: additional API calls will be necessary to redirect the move, cancel existing journeys and create new journeys.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The lockout event object to be created. It must specify `timestamp`, `reason` and `location`.

post.summary: [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED] Creates a redirect event
post.description:
## [NOT YET IMPLEMENTED]

Creating a redirect event changes the underlying move's destination (`to_location`). It _does not_ alter the journeys associated with the move: additional API calls will be necessary to cancel existing journeys and create new journeys.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The redirect event object to be created. It must specify `timestamp`, `reason` and `to_location`.

parameters.name: filter[police_national_computer]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include people identified by that police_national_computer. Either filter[police_national_computer] or filter[prison_number] or both filters are required.

parameters.name: filter[prison_number]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include people identified by that prison_number. Either filter[police_national_computer] or filter[prison_number] or both filters are required.

post.summary: Creates a new person and their associated profile

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The person object to be created

patch.summary: Updates an existing person and their associated profile. Aliased as PUT /people/{person_id}.

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: The ID of the person

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The person object to be updated

get.summary: Returns a list of allocation complex cases
Returns a list of assessment questions, optionally filtered by category

parameters.name: filter[category]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include move detail types for the given category

get.summary: Returns a list of locations, optionally filtered by type or NOMIS agency ID

parameters.name: filter[location_type]
parameters.description: Filters results by location type, e.g. court or prison

parameters.name: filter[nomis_agency_id]
parameters.description: Filters results by NOMIS agency ID

parameters.name: filter[supplier_id]
parameters.description: Filters results to only include locations from the given supplier

get.summary: Returns the details of a location

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location

get.summary: Returns the details of a supplier

parameters.name: supplier_key
parameters.description: The key of the supplier
